sentences.en: Add a pinch of salt to taste.
sentences.cn: 加一撮盐来调味。

sentences.en: At a pinch it can be used as a weapon.
sentences.cn: 必要时可以把它当作武器.

sentences.en: Consumers are spending less and traders are feeling the pinch.
sentences.cn: 消费者支出在减少，商人感觉手头拮据。

sentences.en: Davalillo goes up to pinch-hit.
sentences.cn: 达瓦里洛上场替补击球。

sentences.en: Eleanor is always a penny - pinch ever since she has been young.
sentences.cn: 埃莉诺从年轻时候起就一直是个非常吝啬的人.

sentences.en: Everyone knew he was in a pinch.
sentences.cn: 每个人都知道他境况艰难。

sentences.en: Gordon pinch ran for Gomez.
sentences.cn: 戈登上场替补跑垒员戈麦斯。

sentences.en: He pinched her cheek.
sentences.cn: 他捏了一下她的脸颊。

sentences.en: He put a pinch of salt on his food.
sentences.cn: 他在自己的食物上撒了一撮盐.

sentences.en: I'd pinch his buns and kiss his neck.
sentences.cn: 我想掐他的屁股，亲他的脖子。

sentences.en: I'd trust her in a pinch.
sentences.cn: 身处困境时，我信任她。

sentences.en: In a pinch, you could get home on foot.
sentences.cn: 在万不得已时, 你可以步行回家.

sentences.en: Put all the ingredients, including a pinch of salt, into a food processor.
sentences.cn: 将所有的配料，连同一撮盐，放进食品加工机里。

sentences.en: Season with salt, pepper and a pinch of cayenne.
sentences.cn: 调以盐、胡椒和少许辣椒粉。

sentences.en: She gave him a little pinch.
sentences.cn: 她轻轻地捏了他一下。

sentences.en: She gave him a pinch to wake him up.
sentences.cn: 她拧了他一下以弄醒他.

sentences.en: She gave him a playful pinch.
sentences.cn: 她开玩笑地捏了他一把。

sentences.en: She would pinch on food in order to spend on clothing.
sentences.cn: 她过去常把伙食费省下来买衣服.

sentences.en: These shoes must be too small because they pinch.
sentences.cn: 因为这双鞋夹脚,所以他们一定是太小了.

sentences.en: We have to stop her pinching her baby brother.
sentences.cn: 我们不能让她再掐她小弟弟了。

words.tran_cn: 压紧的；痛苦的；困难的；收缩的

phrases.tran_cn: 吝啬的：过于节俭或吝啬的
[化]夹点（饱和蒸气与冷却剂最小温差点）

trans.tran_en: A pinch of an ingredient such as salt is the amount of it that you can hold between your thumb and your first finger
to press a part of someone’s skin very tightly between your finger and thumb, especially so that it hurts

trans.tran_cn: 捏，掐，挤痛，夹痛，使（植物）枯萎，凋谢，使紧缺，节制
trans.tran_en: to press a part of someone’s skin very tightly between your finger and thumb, especially so that it hurts
